intro: Zygia paucijugata, commonly known as the few-lobed zygia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Zygia paucijugata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
